contents.description: An action such as attack or cast a spell. You may choose to use an action or move first.
Move a distance up to your speed of [x]. You may choose to use an action or move first, or move then do an action and then move again, up to your base speed.
Some class features and spells allow you to make a bonus action, for example many cantrips (zero-th level spells) can be cast as a bonus action.
Some actions require neither action nor your move, or can be done while making another action. An example is shouting to communicate to another member, or interacting with an object.

Certain special abilities, spells, and situations allow you to take a special action called a reaction. This is an instant response to a trigger of some kind, which can occur on your turn or on someone else's.
If a creature is within your reach and moves away from you, you may make a free attack against it.
contents.usage: Any time the condition is met

contents.description: Attempt to hit a target using a weapon or weapons that you are wielding (or your fists). Target must be within reach (within [SPEED] feet).

Attempt to hit a target using a ranged weapon. Target must be within the range specified by your weapon. Attempting to hit targets further than normal range will incur disadvantage on the to-hit roll.
Gain extra movement up to your base speed of [SPEED] feet.
contents.usage: Once per turn, up to [SPEED] feet
